title: Foreigners to Feature in Commander’s Cup Golf
byline: The 13th Commander’s Cup Golf Championship 2026 will tee off at the Eagles Golf Links on Saturday with the first group scheduled to start at 6.00 am. The annual showpiece continues to grow in stature, drawing strong participation from across the island and overseas.

title: NOCSL to Hold Special General Meeting on March 14
byline: The National Olympic Committee of Sri Lanka (NOCSL) has announced that a Special General Meeting (SGM) will be held on March 14 at 4.00 p.m. at the Hemasiri Fernando Auditorium, Olympic House, Independence Avenue, Colombo.

title: Namal’s Cambridge union lecture cancelled following diaspora protests
byline: The scheduled lecture of Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organizer and Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa at the Cambridge Union has been cancelled following strong opposition from sections of the Tamil diaspora in the United Kingdom.

title: US and Indonesia finalise deal to cut tariffs to 19%
byline: President Donald Trump’s administration and the Indonesian government say they have finalised an agreement to lower US tariffs on the South East Asian country to 19% from 32%.

title: Sri Lanka launches Rs.2bn interim promotion campaign to target high-yield tourists
byline: Sri Lanka is set to launch an interim digital and public relations campaign with an investment of Rs. 2 billion, aiming to shift the tourism industry’s focus from mere arrival volumes to attracting high-yielding

title: Global aircraft shortage hits SriLankan Airlines’ fleet renewal
byline: SriLankan Airlines, the national carrier, is in need of at least seven more aircraft for new routes and rationalisation of existing ones, but the current global shortage has hampered the process of acquiring any, a minister said.

title: Govt. cracks down on illegal foreign-run tourism businesses
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism authorities, in collaboration with law enforcement agencies, have intensified their crackdown on illegal tourism operations run by foreigners, resulting in the apprehension of 75 individuals

title: Six arrested in arugambay for poaching and bush meat trade
byline: As part of an ongoing crackdown on poachers and the illegal bush meat trade, Special Task Force (STF) officers in Arugambay arrested six individuals suspected of killing wild animals. The arrests were made on Wednesday (18) when the suspects were attempting to transport the meat by boat.

title: The Chinese AI app sending Hollywood into a panic
byline: A new artificial intelligence (AI) model developed by the Chinese company behind TikTok rocked Hollywood this week - not just because of what it can do, but what it could mean for creative industries.

title: Colombo gears up for IRONMAN 70.3 with IRONKIDS
byline: Colombo’s youngest athletes are set to take centre stage as IRONKIDS Colombo makes its exciting return as part of the build-up to the world-class IRONMAN 70.3 Colombo, placing children and families at the heart of Sri Lanka’s biggest endurance sports celebration.

title: NMRA decisions could jeopardise quality of eye drugs in state hospitals: Dr. Sanjeewa
byline: President of the Medical and Civil Rights Doctors’ Trade Union Alliance, Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa, has alleged that arbitrary decision-making by the National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA) could lead to questionable quality eye medications entering the State hospital system.

title: Anusha Pelpita granted bail
byline: Former Director General of the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission (TRC), Anusha Pelpita, who was arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption over allegations of unlawfully acquiring assets worth nearly Rs. 46 million, was released on bail.

title: Mystery donor gives Japanese city $3.6m in gold bars to fix water system
byline: A Japanese city has received a hefty donation to help fix its ageing water system: 21kg (46lb) in gold bars.

title: Properties worth rupees one billion belonging to underworld figures confiscated: Minister
byline: Properties worth more than Rs. 1 billion belonging to underworld figures have been confiscated by the government, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala told Parliament today.

title: Speaker appoints select committee to look into Provincial Council election issues
byline: Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne today announced in Parliament the appointment of a select committee under the chairmanship of Minister Vijitha Herath to look into the holding of the Provincial Councils elections.

title: New electronic monitoring law to ease prison overcrowding
byline: Minister of National Integration and Justice Harshana Nanayakkara announced that a new Act enabling selected prisoners to be placed under house arrest through electronic monitoring is being drafted to address severe prison overcrowding in the country.

title: Over 99,000 arrested under ‘Ratama Ekata’ anti-drug operation
byline: The number of suspects arrested under the nationwide ‘Ratama Ekata’ operation has exceeded 99,000, Police said.

title: PM Modi meets Sri Lankan President at AI Summit
byline: The meeting was part of a series of high-level engagements undertaken by the Prime Minister with global leaders attending the summit, which is being held in New Delhi and focuses on responsible artificial intelligence governance and inclusive technological advancement.

title: Trump directs US government to prepare release of files on aliens and UFOs
byline: US President Donald Trump says he will direct US agencies, including the defence department, to ’’begin the process of identifying and releasing’’ government files on aliens and extraterrestrial life.

title: Minister, MP clash in Parliament over allegation
byline: A verbal clash erupted between Minister of Power and Energy Kumara Jayakody and opposition MP Ajith P. Perera, after the latter came up with an allegation that the Minister was removed from the Fertilizer Corporation due to a fruad.

title: Wanninayake re-elected as President of Colombo Magistrate’s Court Lawyers’ Association
byline: Attorney-at-Law Gunaratne Wanninayake has been re-elected as the President of the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court Lawyers’ Association, securing the confidence of members despite the recent controversy surrounding him.

title: Sri Lanka’s biggest-ever Rs. 630 Mn lottery jackpot claimed
byline: Sri Lanka’s largest-ever lottery jackpot, amounting to more than Rs. 63 crore, has been claimed, officials said on Friday.

title: Govt warns against gas supply disruptions
byline: Trade Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe assured that the Government will not allow consumers to be inconvenienced amid supply disruptions linked to private sector supplier LAUGFS Gas PLC, stressing that there is no national shortage of LP gas.

title: Ravi K grills Govt over reserve credibility
byline: UNP MP Ravi Karunanayake demanded an urgent statement in Parliament over the credibility of Sri Lanka’s Gross Official Reserves (GOR), possible foreign exchange leakages and the consistency of the Central Bank’s regulatory actions.

title: Akuregoda lawyer couple killing: Suspect’s AI-generated images released
byline: Police have released AI-generated images of a suspect wanted in connection with the fatal shooting of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda earlier this month, seeking public assistance to track him down.

title: Fans flock to Japan zoo to see viral baby monkey Punch
byline: Six-month-old Punch became an internet sensation after footage of him clinging forlornly to zookeepers and dragging around a stuffed orangutan toy was widely shared on X.

title: Johnston Fernando further remanded
byline: Former Minister Johnston Fernando, his two sons, and another suspect, were today ordered to be further remanded until March 6 by the Wattala Magistrate’s Court.

title: Global trucking giant Dongfeng launches in Sri Lanka with Euro Motors
byline: Sri Lanka’s commercial vehicle sector welcomed a major new player with the official launch of Dongfeng Trucks on February 17 at Waters Edge. The brand enters the Sri Lankan market through a strategic partnership between Euro Motors, a subsidiary of Euro Holdings, and Dongfeng Motor Corporation, promising high-performance, value-driven transport solutions for businesses across the island.

title: Supreme Court rules that Trump’s sweeping emergency tariffs are illegal
byline: The Supreme Court on Friday ruled that President Donald Trump violated federal law when he unilaterally imposed sweeping tariffs across the globe, a striking loss for the White House on an issue that has been central to the president’s foreign policy and economic agenda.

title: A Captain has Spoken
byline: Forget the load of television pundits, leave aside the side-stepping rhetoric of coaches and the bunkum played out by captains and then bring in the unsung captain of the headsturning Zimbabwe cricket team that asked for nothing but gave something none may have asked for that has taken the sport to more people and places at the ongoing T20 World Cup.

title: Sri Lanka’s Super 8 fixture: Tickets ‘Sold Out’
byline: Tickets for all of Sri Lanka’s Super 8 fixtures at the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026 have been completely sold out, according to the official ticketing platform of the International Cricket Council.

title: Table Toppers CR may have a match
byline: The stage is set for a pulsating finale to the domestic season as the Inter-Club Rugby League 2025/2026 reaches its grand climax under lights at Longdon Place tomorrow when defending champions, Kandy Sports Club lock horns with CR and FC the League toppers in what is being touted as a final inside the League. Kick-off is scheduled for 7 pm. In a move by Sri Lanka Rugby, points difference accumulated during the league phase will not come into play
